properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of this Dashbaord List.

properties.name: list description
type
properties.description: (Required) The type of this dashboard. Available options are: custom_timeboard, custom_screenboard, integration_screenboard, integration_timeboard, and host_timeboard

properties.name: dash_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of this dashboard.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) Title of the dashboard.

properties.name: widget
properties.description: (Required) Nested block describing a widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple widget blocks are allowed within a datadog_dashboard resource

properties.name: layout_type
properties.description:
(Required) Layout type of the dashboard. Available values are: ordered (previous timeboard) or free (previous screenboard layout).
Note: This value cannot be changed. Converting a dashboard from free <-> ordered requires destroying and re-creating the dashboard. Instead of using ForceNew, this is a manual action as many underlying widget configs need to be updated to work for the updated layout, otherwise the new dashboard won't be created properly.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the dashboard.

properties.name: is_read_only
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this dashboard is read-only. If true, only the author and admins can make changes to it.

properties.name: notify_list
properties.description: (Optional) List of handles of users to notify when changes are made to this dashboard.

properties.name: template_variables
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a template variable. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple template_variable blocks are allowed within a datadog_dashboard resource.

properties.name: nested-widget-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget blocks
Nested widget blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: layout
properties.description: (Required for widgets in dashboards with free layout_type only). The structure of this block is described below

properties.name: list description
properties.description: A widget should have exactly one of the following nested blocks describing the widget definition:

properties.name: alert_graph_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for a Alert Graph widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • alert_id: (Required) The ID of the monitor used by the widget.
  • viz_type: (Required) Type of visualization to use when displaying the widget. Either "timeseries" or "toplist".
  • title: (Optional) The title of the widget.
  • title_size: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.
  • title_align: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right"
  • time: (Optional) Nested block describing the timeframe to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: alert_value_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for an Alert Value widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • alert_id: (Required) The ID of the monitor used by the widget.
  • precision: (Optional) The precision to use when displaying the value. Use "*" for maximum precision.
  • unit: (Optional) The unit for the value displayed in the widget.
  • text_align: (Optional) The alignment of the text in the widget.
  • title: (Optional) The title of the widget.
  • title_size: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.
  • title_align: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right"

properties.name: change_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for a Change widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • request: (Required) Nested block describing the request to use when displaying the widget. Multiple request blocks are allowed with the following structure:
    • q: (Required) The metric query to use in the widget.
    • change_type: (Optional) Whether to show absolute or relative change. One of "absolute", "relative".
    • compare_to - (Optional) Choose from when to compare current data to. One of "hour_before", "day_before", "week_before" or "month_before".
    • increase_good - (Optional) Boolean indicating whether an increase in the value is good (thus displayed in green) or not (thus displayed in red).
    • order_by - (Optional) One of "change", "name", "present" (present value) or "past" (past value).
    • order_dir - (Optional) Either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending).
    • show_present - (Optional) If set to "true", displays current value.
  • title: (Optional) The title of the widget.
  • title_size: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.
  • title_align: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".
  • time: (Optional) Nested block describing the timeframe to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

  • compare_to - (Optional) Choose from when to compare current data to. One of "hour_before", "day_before", "week_before" or "month_before".
  • increase_good - (Optional) Boolean indicating whether an increase in the value is good (thus displayed in green) or not (thus displayed in red).
  • order_by - (Optional) One of "change", "name", "present" (present value) or "past" (past value).
  • order_dir - (Optional) Either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending).
  • show_present - (Optional) If set to "true", displays current value.

  • tags - (Optional) List of tags to use in the widget.

properties.name: hostmap_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for a Hostmap widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • request: (Required) Nested block describing the request to use when displaying the widget. Multiple request blocks are allowed with the following structure:
    • fill: (Optional) The query used to fill the map. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
      • q: (Required) The metric query to use in the widget.
    • size: (Optional) The query used to size the map. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
      • q: (Required) The metric query to use in the widget.
  • node_type - (Optional) The type of node used. Either "host" or "container".
  • no_metric_hosts - (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to show nodes with no metrics.
  • no_group_hosts - (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to show ungrouped nodes.
  • group - (Optional) The list of tags to group nodes by.
  • scope - (Optional) The list of tags to filter nodes by.
  • style - (Optional) Style of the widget graph. One nested block is allowed with the following structure:
    • palette - (Optional) Color palette to apply to the widget. The available options are available here: https://docs.datadoghq.com/graphing/widgets/timeseries/#appearance.
    • palette_flip - (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to flip the palette tones.
    • fill_min - (Optional) Min value to use to color the map.
    • fill_max - (Optional) Max value to use to color the map.
  • title: (Optional) The title of the widget.
  • title_size: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.
  • title_align: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".

properties.name: image_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for a Image widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:

  • sizing - (Optional) The preferred method to adapt the dimensions of the image to those of the widget. One of "center" (center the image in the tile), "zoom" (zoom the image to cover the whole tile) or "fit" (fit the image dimensions to those of the tile).
  • margin - (Optional) The margins to use around the image. Either "small" or "large".

: The definition for a Manage Status widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • query: (Required) The query to use in the widget.
  • sort - (Optional) The method to use to sort monitors. One of : "desc" or "asc". count - (Optional) The number of monitors to display. start - (Optional) The start of the list. Typically 0.
  • display_format - (Optional") The display setting to use. One of "counts", "list", or "countsAndList".
  • color_preference - (Optional") Whether to colorize text or background. One of "text", "background".
  • hide_zero_counts - (Optional") Boolean indicating whether to hide empty categories.

  • title_size: (Optional) The size of the widget's title. Default is 16.
  • title_align: (Optional) The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".

properties.name: note_definition
properties.description:
: The definition for a Note widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • content - (Required) Content of the note
  • background_color - (Optional) Background color of the note.
  • font_size - (Optional) Size of the text.
  • text_align - (Optional) How to align the text on the widget. Available values are: center, left, or right.
  • show_tick - (Optional) Whether to show a tick or not.
  • tick_pos - (Optional") When tick = true, string with a percent sign indicating the position of the tick. Example: use tick_pos = "50%" for centered alignment.
  • tick_edge - (Optional") When tick = true, string indicating on which side of the widget the tick should be displayed. One of "bottom", "top", "left", "right".

properties.name: timeseries_definition

: The definition for a Timeseries widget. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the following structure:
  • request: (Required) Nested block describing the request to use when displaying the widget. Multiple request blocks are allowed with the following structure (exactly only one of q, apm_query, log_query or process_query is required within the request block):
    • q: (Optional) The metric query to use in the widget
    • apm_query: (Optional) The APM query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.
    • log_query: (Optional) The log query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.
    • process_query: (Optional) The process query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.
    • display_type - (Optional) Type of display to use for the request. Available values are: area, bars, or line.
    • style - (Optional) Style of the widget graph. One nested block is allowed with the following structure:
      • palette - (Optional) Color palette to apply to the widget. The available options are available here: https://docs.datadoghq.com/graphing/widgets/timeseries/#appearance.
      • line_type - (Optional) Type of lines displayed. Available values are: dashed, dotted, or solid.
      • line_width - (Optional) Width of line displayed. Available values are: normal, thick, or thin.
    • metadata - (Optional). Used to define expression aliases. Multiple nested blocks are allowed with the following structure:
      • expression - (Required)
      • alias_name - (Optional)
  • marker - (Optional) Nested block describing the marker to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple marker blocks are allowed within a given tile_def block.
  • title: (Optional) The title of the widget.

properties.description: (Optional) Reference to which monitor this downtime is applied. When scheduling downtime for a given monitor, datadog changes silenced property of the monitor to match the end POSIX timestamp. Note: this will effectively change the silenced attribute of the referenced monitor. If that monitor is also tracked by Terraform and you don't want it to be unmuted on the next terraform apply, see details in the monitor resource documentation. This option also conflicts with monitor_tags use none or one or the other.

name
properties.description: (Required) Name of Datadog monitor

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Required) The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending on the monitor type, please see the API Reference for details. Warning: terraform plan won't perform any validation of the query contents.

properties.name: message
properties.description: (Required) A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events.

properties.name: escalation_message
properties.description: (Optional) A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the '@username' notification allowed elsewhere.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: thresholds - (Optional)

• Metric alerts: A dictionary of thresholds by threshold type. Currently we have four threshold types for metric alerts: critical, critical recovery, warning, and warning recovery. Critical is defined in the query, but can also be specified in this option. Warning and recovery thresholds can only be specified using the thresholds option. Example usage: thresholds = { critical = 90 critical_recovery = 85 warning = 80 warning_recovery = 75 } Warning: the critical threshold value must match the one contained in the query argument. The threshold from the previous example is valid along with a query like avg(last_1h):avg:system.disk.in_use{role:sqlserver} by {host} > 90 but along with something like avg(last_1h):avg:system.disk.in_use{role:sqlserver} by {host} > 95 would make the Datadog API return a HTTP error 400, complaining "The value provided for parameter 'query' is invalid".

• Service checks: A dictionary of thresholds by status. Because service checks can have multiple thresholds, we don't define them directly in the query. Default values: thresholds = { ok = 1 critical = 1 warning = 1 unknown = 1 }

properties.name: notify_no_data
properties.description: • notify_no_data (Optional) A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to false.

properties.name: new_host_delay
properties.description: • new_host_delay (Optional) Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to 300.

properties.name: evaluation_delay
properties.description: • evaluation_delay (Optional, only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a non-negative integer. For example, if the value is set to 300 (5min), the timeframe is set to last_5m and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have data during evaluation.

properties.name: no_data_timeframe
properties.description: • no_data_timeframe (Optional) The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks. Default: 2x timeframe for metric alerts, 2 minutes for service checks. Defaults to 10 minutes.

properties.name: renotify_interval
properties.description: • renotify_interval (Optional) The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.

properties.name: notify_audit
properties.description: • notify_audit (Optional) A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to false.

properties.name: timeout_h
properties.description: • timeout_h (Optional) The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state. Defaults to false.

properties.name: include_tags
properties.description: • include_tags (Optional) A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor automatically insert its triggering tags into the title. Defaults to true.

properties.name: enable_logs_sample
properties.description: • enable_logs_sample (Optional) A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. Defaults to false. This is only used by log monitors. triggering tags into the title. Defaults to true.

properties.name: require_full_window
properties.description: • require_full_window (Optional) A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set this to False for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: True for "on average", "at all times" and "in total" aggregation. False otherwise.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: • locked (Optional) A boolean indicating whether changes to to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to False.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags (Optional) A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

properties.name: list description
properties.description: threshold_windows (Optional) A mapping containing recovery_window and trigger_window values, e.g. last_15m. Can only be used for, and are required for, anomaly monitors.

properties.name: recovery_window
properties.description: describes how long an anomalous metric must be normal before the alert recovers.

properties.name: trigger_window
properties.description: describes how long a metric must be anomalous before an alert triggers.

properties.name: silenced
properties.description:
• silenced (Optional) Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is 0. Use -1 if you want to unmute the scope. Deprecated The silenced parameter is being deprecated in favor of the downtime resource. This will be removed in the next major version of the Terraform Provider.

    To mute the alert completely:

    silenced = {
  "*" =  0
}

    To mute role:db for a short time:

    silenced = {
  "role:db" = 1412798116
}

    Note: due to HCL limitations, it is impossible to use interpolations in keys. For example, the following will result in muting the scope role:${var:role} (no interpolation is done):

    silenced = {
    "role:${var:role}" = 0
}

    To workaround this, you can use the map function of HCL:

    silenced = ${map("role:${var:role}", 0)}

properties.name: silencing-by-hand-and-by-downtimes
properties.description: » Silencing by Hand and by Downtimes
There are two ways how to silence a single monitor:

properties.name: Mute it by hand
properties.description: • Mute it by hand

properties.name: Create a Downtime
properties.description: • Create a Downtime

Both of these actions add a new value to the silenced map. This can be problematic if the silenced attribute doesn't contain them in your Terraform, as they would be removed on next terraform apply invocation. In order to prevent that from happening, you can add following to your monitor:

lifecycle {
  ignore_changes = ["silenced"]
}
The above will make sure that any changes to the silenced attribute are ignored.
This issue doesn't apply to multi-monitor downtimes (those that don't contain monitor_id), as these don't influence contents of the silenced attribute.

properties.name: text_size
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The size of the text in the widget.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The unit for the value displayed in the widget.

properties.name: precision
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value") The precision to use when displaying the value. Use "*" for maximum precision.

properties.name: text_align
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "free_text", "alert_value", "note") The alignment of the text in the widget.

properties.name: alert_id
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value", "alert_graph") The ID of the monitor used by the widget.

properties.name: auto_refresh
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_value", "alert_graph") Boolean indicating whether the widget is refreshed automatically.

properties.name: legend
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist") Boolean indicating whether to display a legend in the widget.

properties.name: legend_size
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist") The size of the legend displayed in the widget.

properties.name: query
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "event_timeline", "event_stream", "hostmap", "log_stream") The query to use in the widget.

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image", "iframe") The URL to use as a data source for the widget.

properties.name: viz_type
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "alert_graph") Type of visualization to use when displaying the widget. Either "timeseries" or "toplist".

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") List of tags to use in the widget.

properties.name: check
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") The check to use in the widget.

properties.name: group
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") The check group to use in the widget.

properties.name: grouping
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") Either "check" or "cluster", depending on whether the widget should use a single check or a cluster of checks.

properties.name: group_by
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "check_status") When grouping = "cluster", indicates a list of tags to use for grouping.

properties.name: tick
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") Boolean indicating whether a tick should be displayed on the border of the widget.

properties.name: tick_pos
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") When tick = true, string with a percent sign indicating the position of the tick. Example: use tick_pos = "50%" for centered alignment.

properties.name: tick_edge
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") When tick = true, string indicating on which side of the widget the tick should be displayed. One of "bottom", "top", "left", "right".

properties.name: html
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") The content of the widget. HTML tags supported.

properties.name: bgcolor
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "note") The color of the background of the widget.

properties.name: event_size
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "event_stream") The size of the events in the widget. Either "s" (small, title only) or "l" (large, full event).

properties.name: sizing
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image") The preferred method to adapt the dimensions of the image to those of the widget. One of "center" (center the image in the tile), "zoom" (zoom the image to cover the whole tile) or "fit" (fit the image dimensions to those of the tile).

properties.name: margin
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "image") The margins to use around the image. Either "small" or "large".

properties.name: env
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The environment to use.

properties.name: service_service
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The trace service to use.

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The name of the service to use.

properties.name: size_version
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The size of the widget. One of "small", "medium", "large".

properties.name: layout_version
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") The number of columns to use when displaying values. One of "one_column", "two_column", "three_column".

properties.name: must_show_hits
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display hits.

properties.name: must_show_errors
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display errors.

properties.name: must_show_latency
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display latency.

properties.name: must_show_breakdown
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display breakdown.

properties.name: must_show_distribution
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display distribution.

properties.name: must_show_resource_list
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "trace_service") Boolean indicating whether to display resources.

properties.name: display_format
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The display setting to use. One of "counts", "list", or "countsAndList".

properties.name: color_preference
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Whether to colorize text or background. One of "text", "background".

properties.name: hide_zero_counts
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Boolean indicating whether to hide empty categories.

properties.name: manage_status_show_title
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Boolean indicating whether to show a title.

properties.name: manage_status_title_text
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The title of the widget.

properties.name: manage_status_title_size
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The size of the widget's title.

properties.name: manage_status_title_align
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") The alignment of the widget's title. One of "left", "center", or "right".

properties.name: columns
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "log_stream") Stringified list of columns to use. Example: "[\"column1\",\"column2\",\"column3\"]"

properties.name: logset
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "log_stream") ID of the logset to use.

properties.name: time
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "toplist", "event_timeline", "event_stream", "alert_graph", "check_status", "trace_service", "log_stream") Nested block describing the timeframe to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

properties.name: tile_def
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap", "change", "toplist", "process") Nested block describing the content to display in the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

properties.name: params
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "manage_status") Nested block describing the monitors to display. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given widget.

properties.name: nested-widget-time-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget time blocks
Only for widgets of type "timeseries", "toplist", "event_timeline", "event_stream", "alert_graph", "check_status", "trace_service", "log_stream".
Nested widget time blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: live_span
properties.description: (Required) The timeframe to use when displaying the widget. One of "10m", "30m", "1h", "4h", "1d", "2d", "1w".

properties.name: nested-widget-params-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget params blocks
Only for widgets of type "manage_status".
Nested widget params blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: sort
properties.description: (Optional) The method to use to sort monitors. Example: "status,asc".

properties.name: text
properties.description: (Optional) The query to use to get monitors. Example: "status:alert".

properties.name: count
properties.description: (Optional) The number of monitors to display.

properties.name: start
properties.description: (Optional) The start of the list. Typically 0.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def blocks
Only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap", "change", "toplist", "process".
Nested widget tile_def blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: viz
properties.description: (Required) Should be the same as the widget's type. One of "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap", "change", "toplist", "process".

properties.name: request
properties.description: (Required) Nested block describing the request to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple request blocks are allowed within a given tile_def block.

properties.name: marker
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries") Nested block describing the marker to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple marker blocks are allowed within a given tile_def block.

properties.name: event
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries") Nested block describing the event overlays to use when displaying the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given tile_def block.

properties.name: custom_unit
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The unit for the value displayed in the widget

properties.name: autoscale
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") Boolean indicating whether to automatically scale the tile.

properties.name: precision
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The precision to use when displaying the tile.

properties.name: text_align
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The alignment of the text.

properties.name: node_type
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The type of node used. Either "host" or "container".

properties.name: scope
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The list of tags to filter nodes by.

properties.name: group
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") The list of tags to group nodes by.

properties.name: no_group_hosts
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Boolean indicating whether to show ungrouped nodes.

properties.name: no_metric_hosts
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Boolean indicating whether to show nodes with no metrics.

properties.name: style
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "hostmap") Nested block describing how to display the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given tile_def block.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-style-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def style blocks
Only for widgets of type "hostmap".
Nested widget tile_def style blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Color set to use to display nodes. One of "green_to_orange", "yellow_to_green", "YlOrRd" (warm), "hostmap_blues" (cool).

properties.name: palette_flip
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to flip how the hostmap is rendered. For example, with the default palette, low values are represented as green, with high values as orange. If palette_flip is "true", then low values will be orange, and high values will be green.

properties.name: fill_min
properties.description: (Optional) Metric value corresponding to minimum color fill.

properties.name: fill_max
properties.description: (Optional) Metric value corresponding to maximum color fill.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-marker-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def marker blocks
Only for widgets of type "timeseries".
Nested widget tile_def marker blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) How the marker lines will look. Possible values are {"error", "warning", "info", "ok"} {"dashed", "solid", "bold"}. Example: "error dashed".

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) Mathematical expression describing the marker. Examples: "y > 1", "-5 < y < 0", "y = 19".

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) A label for the line or range.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-event-block
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def event block
Only for widgets of type "timeseries".
Nested widget tile_def event blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: q
properties.description: (Required) The search query for event overlays.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-request-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def request blocks

Only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "change", "hostmap", "process". Nested widget tile_def request blocks have the following structure (exactly only one of q, apm_query, log_query or process_query is required within the request block):

properties.name: q
properties.description: (Optional) Only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "change", "hostmap") The query of the request. Pro tip: Use the JSON tab inside the Datadog UI to help build you query strings.

properties.name: apm_query
properties.description: (Optional) The APM query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: log_query
properties.description: (Optional) The log query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: process_query
properties.description: (Optional) The process query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "hostmap") Choose the type of representation to use for this query. For widgets of type "timeseries" and "query_value", use one of "line", "bars" or "area". For widgets of type "hostmap", use "fill" or "size".

properties.name: query_type
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Use "process".

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") The metric you want to use for the widget.

properties.name: text_filter
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") The search query for the widget.

properties.name: tag_filters
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Tags to use for filtering.

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "process") Integer indicating the number of hosts to limit to.

properties.name: aggregator
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "query_value") The aggregator to use for time aggregation. One of "avg", "min", "max", "sum", "last".

properties.name: compare_to
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Choose from when to compare current data to. One of "hour_before", "day_before", "week_before" or "month_before".

properties.name: change_type
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Whether to show absolute or relative change. One of "absolute", "relative".

properties.name: order_by
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") One of "change", "name", "present" (present value) or "past" (past value).

properties.name: order_dir
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Either "asc" (ascending) or "desc" (descending).

properties.name: extra_col
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") If set to "present", displays current value. Can be left empty otherwise.

properties.name: increase_good
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "change") Boolean indicating whether an increase in the value is good (thus displayed in green) or not (thus displayed in red).

properties.name: style
properties.description: (Optional, only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "process") describing how to display the widget. The structure of this block is described below. At most one such block should be present in a given request block.

properties.name: conditional_format
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the style if certain conditions are met. Currently only applies to Query Value and Top List type graphs.

properties.name: metadata_json
properties.description: (Optional) A JSON blob (preferrably created using jsonencode) representing mapping of query expressions to alias names. Note that the query expressions in metadata_json will be ignored if they're not present in the query. For example, this is how you define metadata_json with Terraform >= 0.12: metadata_json = jsonencode({ "avg:redis.info.latency_ms{$host}": { "alias": "Redis latency" } }) And here's how you define metadata_json with Terraform < 0.12: ``` variable "my_metadata" { default = { "avg:redis.info.latency_ms{$host}" = { "alias": "Redis latency" } } }

resource "datadog_screenboard" "SomeScreenboard" { ... metadata_json = "${jsonencode(var.my_metadata)}" } `` Note that this has to be a JSON blob because of [limitations](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform/issues/6215) of Terraform's handling complex nested structures. This is also why the key is calledmetadata_jsoneven though it setsmetadata` attribute on the API call.

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-request-style-block
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def request style block
Only for widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", "process".
The nested style blocks has the following structure:

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Color of the line drawn. For widgets of type "timeseries", "query_value", "toplist", one of: "classic", "cool", "warm", "purple", "orange" or "gray". For widgets of type "process", one of: "dog_classic_area", "YlOrRd", "GnBu", "Reds", "Oranges", "Greens", "Blues", "Purples".

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) Line width. Possible values: "thin", "normal", "thick". Default: "normal".

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of line drawn. Possible values: "dashed", "solid", "dotted". Default: "solid".

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-request-apm_query-and-log_query-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def request apm_query and log_query blocks
Nested apm_query and log_query blocks have the following structure (Visit the Graph Primer for more information about these values):

properties.name: index
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: list description
aggregation
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: list description
query
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: list description
facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: sort
properties.description: (Optional). One nested block is allowed with the following structure:

properties.name: aggregation
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: order
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-request-process_query-blocks
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def request process_query blocks
Nested process_query blocks have the following structure (Visit the Graph Primer for more information about these values):

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: search_by
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: filter_by
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: nested-widget-tile_def-request-conditional_format-block
properties.description: » Nested widget tile_def request conditional_format block
The nested conditional_format blocks has the following structure:

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Color scheme to be used if the condition is met. One of: "red_on_white", "white_on_red", "yellow_on_white", "white_on_yellow", "green_on_white", "white_on_green", "gray_on_white", "white_on_gray", "custom_text", "custom_bg", "custom_image".

properties.name: comparator
properties.description: (Required) Comparison operator. Example: ">", "<".

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Value that is the threshold for the conditional format.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Custom color (e.g., #205081).

properties.name: invert
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean indicating whether to invert color scheme.

properties.name: nested-template_variable-blocks
properties.description: » Nested template_variable blocks
Nested template_variable blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The variable name. Can be referenced as \$name in graph request q query strings.

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: (Optional) The tag group. Default: no tag group.

properties.name: default
properties.description: (Optional) The default tag. Default: "*" (match all).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: list description
metric
monitor
name
properties.description: (Required) Name of Datadog service level objective

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) A description of this service level objective.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A list of tags to associate with your service level objective. This can help you categorize and filter service level objectives in the service level objectives page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

properties.name: list description
timeframe
properties.description:
(Required) - the time frame for the objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API documentation page. Available options to choose from are:
  • 7d
  • 30d
  • 90d

properties.name: 7d
30d
90d
target
properties.description: (Required) the objective's target [0,100]

properties.name: target_display
properties.description: (Optional) the string version to specify additional digits in the case of 99 but want 3 digits like 99.000 to display.

properties.name: warning
properties.description: (Optional) the objective's warning value [0,100]. This must be > target value.

properties.name: warning_display
properties.description: (Optional) the string version to specify additional digits in the case of 99 but want 3 digits like 99.000 to display.

properties.name: 7d
30d
90d

properties.description: The following options are specific to the type of service level objective:

properties.name: list description
query
properties.description:
(Required) The metric query configuration to use for the SLI. This is a dictionary and requires both the numerator and denominator fields which should be count metrics using the sum aggregator.
  • numerator

properties.name: numerator
properties.description: (Required) the sum of all the good events

properties.name: denominator
properties.description: (Required) the sum of the total events

properties.name: Example Usage:
properties.description: • Example Usage:

properties.name: numerator
properties.description: (Required) the sum of all the good events

properties.name: denominator
properties.description: (Required) the sum of the total events

properties.name: Example Usage:
properties.description: • Example Usage:

query {
    numerator   = "sum:my.custom.count.metric{type:good}.as_count()"
    denominator = "sum:my.custom.count.metric{*}.as_count()" 
}

properties.name: list description
monitor_ids
properties.description: (Optional) A list of numeric monitor IDs for which to use as SLIs. Their tags will be auto-imported into monitor_tags field in the API resource. At least 1 of monitor_ids or monitor_search must be provided.

properties.name: monitor_search
properties.description: (Optional) The monitor query search used on the monitor search API to add monitor_ids by searching. Their tags will be auto-imported into monitor_tags field in the API resource. At least 1 of monitor_ids or monitor_search must be provided.

properties.name: groups
properties.description: (Optional) A custom set of groups from the monitor(s) for which to use as the SLI instead of all the groups.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Synthetics test type (api or browser)

properties.name: subtype
properties.description: (Optional) For type=api, http or ssl (Default = http)

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of Datadog synthetics test

properties.name: message
properties.description: (Required) A message to include with notifications for this synthetics test. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Required) A list of tags to associate with your synthetics test. This can help you categorize and filter tests in the manage synthetics page of the UI.

properties.name: list description
method
properties.description: (Optional) For type=api and subtype=http, one of DELETE, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, POST, PUT

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) Any url

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) For type=api, any value between 0 and 60 (Default = 60)

properties.name: body
properties.description: (Optional) Request body

properties.name: list description
host
properties.description: (Required) host name

properties.name: port
properties.description: (Required) port number

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: (Optional) For type=api, any value between 0 and 60 (Default = 60)

properties.name: list description
method
properties.description: (Required) no-op, use GET

properties.name: url
properties.description: (Required) Any url

properties.name: request_headers
properties.description: (Optional) Header name and value map

properties.name: list description
type
properties.description: (Required) body, header, responseTime, statusCode

properties.name: operator
properties.description: (Required) Please refer to Datadog documentation as operator depend on assertion type

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Required) Expected value, please refer to Datadog documentation as target depend on assertion type

properties.name: property
properties.description: (Optional) if assertion type is "header", this is a the header name

properties.name: list description
tick_every
properties.description: (Required) How often the test should run (in seconds). Current possible values are 900, 1800, 3600, 21600, 43200, 86400, 604800 plus 60 if type=api or 300 if type=browser

properties.name: follow_redirects
properties.description: (Optional) For type=api, true or false

properties.name: min_failure_duration
properties.description: (Optional) How long the test should be in failure before alerting (integer, number of seconds, max 7200). Default is 0.

properties.name: min_location_failed
properties.description: (Optional) Threshold below which a synthetics test is allowed to fail before sending notifications

properties.name: accept_self_signed
properties.description: (Optional) For type=ssl, true or false

properties.name: locations
properties.description: (Required) Please refer to Datadog documentation for available locations (e.g. "aws:eu-central-1")

properties.name: device_ids
properties.description: (Optional) "laptop_large", "tablet" or "mobile_small" (only available if type=browser)

properties.name: status
properties.description: (Required) "live", "paused"
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) The name of the dashboard.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) A description of the dashboard's content.

properties.name: read_only
properties.description: (Optional) The read-only status of the timeboard. Default is false.

properties.name: graph
properties.description: (Required) Nested block describing a graph definition. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple graph blocks are allowed within a datadog_timeboard resource.

properties.name: template_variable
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing a template variable. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple template_variable blocks are allowed within a datadog_timeboard resource.

properties.name: nested-graph-blocks
properties.description: » Nested graph blocks
Nested graph blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Required) The name of the graph.

properties.name: viz
properties.description: (Required) The type of visualization to use for the graph. Valid choices are "change", "distribution", "heatmap", "hostmap", "query_value", timeseries", and "toplist".

properties.name: request
properties.description: Nested block describing a graph definition request (a metric query to plot on the graph). The structure of this block is described below. Multiple request blocks are allowed within a graph block.

properties.name: events
properties.description: (Optional) A list of event filter strings. Note that, while supported by the Datadog API, the Datadog UI does not (currently) support multiple event filters very well, so use at your own risk.

properties.name: autoscale
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean that determines whether to autoscale graphs.

properties.name: precision
properties.description: (Optional) Number of digits displayed, use * for full precision.

properties.name: custom_unit
properties.description: (Optional) Display a custom unit on the graph (such as 'hertz')

properties.name: text_align
properties.description: (Optional) How to align text in the graph, can be one of 'left', 'center', or 'right'.

properties.name: style
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing hostmaps. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: group
properties.description: (Optional) List of groups for hostmaps (shown as 'group by' in the UI).

properties.name: include_no_metric_hosts
properties.description: (Optional) If set to true, will display hosts on hostmap that have no reported metrics.

properties.name: include_ungrouped_hosts
properties.description: (Optional) If set to true, will display hosts without groups on hostmaps.

properties.name: node_type
properties.description: (Optional) What nodes to display in a hostmap. Can be one of 'host' (default) or 'container'.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: (Optional) List of scopes for hostmaps (shown as 'filter by' in the UI).

properties.name: yaxis
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing modifications to the yaxis rendering. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: marker
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block describing lines / ranges added to graph for formatting. The structure of this block is described below. Multiple marker blocks are allowed within a graph block.

properties.name: nested-graph-marker-blocks
properties.description: » Nested graph marker blocks
Nested graph marker blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) How the marker lines will look. Possible values are {"error", "warning", "info", "ok"} {"dashed", "solid", "bold"}. Example: "error dashed".

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) Mathematical expression describing the marker. Examples: "y > 1", "-5 < y < 0", "y = 19".

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) A label for the line or range. Warning: when a label is enabled but left empty through the UI, the Datadog API returns a boolean value, not a string. This makes terraform plan fail with a JSON decoding error.

properties.name: nested-graph-yaxis-block
properties.description: » Nested graph yaxis block

properties.name: min
properties.description: (Optional) Minimum bound for the graph's yaxis, a string.

properties.name: max
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum bound for the graph's yaxis, a string.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: (Optional) How to scale the yaxis. Possible values are: "linear", "log", "sqrt", "pow##" (eg. pow2, pow0.5, 2 is used if only "pow" was provided). Default: "linear".

properties.name: nested-graph-request-blocks
properties.description: » Nested graph request blocks
Nested graph request blocks have the following structure (exactly only one of q, apm_query, log_query or process_query is required within the request block):

properties.name: q
properties.description: (Optional) The query of the request. Pro tip: Use the JSON tab inside the Datadog UI to help build you query strings.

properties.name: apm_query
properties.description: (Optional) The APM query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: log_query
properties.description: (Optional) The log query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: process_query
properties.description: (Optional) The process query to use in the widget. The structure of this block is described below.

properties.name: aggregator
properties.description: (Optional) The aggregation method used when the number of data points outnumbers the max that can be shown.

properties.name: stacked
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean value to determine if this is this a stacked area graph. Default: false (line chart).

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Choose how to draw the graph. For example: "line", "bars" or "area". Default: "line".

properties.name: style
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the graph style.

properties.name: conditional_format
properties.description: (Optional) Nested block to customize the graph style if certain conditions are met. Currently only applies to Query Value and Top List type graphs.

properties.name: extra_col
properties.description: (Optional, only for graphs of visualization "change") If set to "present", displays current value. Can be left empty otherwise.

properties.name: metadata_json
properties.description: (Optional) A JSON blob (preferrably created using jsonencode) representing mapping of query expressions to alias names. Note that the query expressions in metadata_json will be ignored if they're not present in the query. For example, this is how you define metadata_json with Terraform >= 0.12:

metadata_json = jsonencode({
    "avg:redis.info.latency_ms{$host}": {
      "alias": "Redis latency"
    }
  })
And here's how you define metadata_json with Terraform < 0.12:

variable "my_metadata" {
    default = {
      "avg:redis.info.latency_ms{$host}" = {
        "alias": "Redis latency"
      }
    }
  }

  resource "datadog_timeboard" "SomeTimeboard" {
    ...
        metadata_json = "${jsonencode(var.my_metadata)}"
  }

Note that this has to be a JSON blob because of limitations of Terraform's handling complex nested structures. This is also why the key is called metadata_json even though it sets metadata attribute on the API call.

properties.name: nested-graph-style-block
properties.description: » Nested graph style block
The nested style block is used specifically for styling hostmap graphs, and has the following structure:

properties.name: fill_max
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum value for the hostmap fill query.

properties.name: fill_min
properties.description: (Optional) Minimum value for the hostmap fill query.

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Spectrum of colors to use when styling a hostmap. For example: "green_to_orange", "yellow_to_green", "YlOrRd", or "hostmap_blues". Default: "green_to_orange".

properties.name: palette_flip
properties.description: (Optional) Flip how the hostmap is rendered. For example, with the default palette, low values are represented as green, with high values as orange. If palette_flip is "true", then low values will be orange, and high values will be green.

properties.name: nested-graph-request-style-block
properties.description: » Nested graph request style block
The nested style blocks has the following structure:

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Color of the line drawn. For example: "classic", "cool", "warm", "purple", "orange" or "gray". Default: "classic".

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) Line width. Possible values: "thin", "normal", "thick". Default: "normal".

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Type of line drawn. Possible values: "dashed", "solid", "dotted". Default: "solid".

properties.name: nested-graph-request-apm_query-and-log_query-blocks
properties.description: » Nested graph request apm_query and log_query blocks
Nested apm_query and log_query blocks have the following structure (Visit the Graph Primer for more information about these values):

properties.name: index
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: list description
aggregation
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: interval
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: list description
query
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: list description
facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: sort
properties.description: (Optional). One nested block is allowed with the following structure:

properties.name: aggregation
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: order
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: facet
properties.description: (Optional)

properties.name: nested-graph-request-process_query-blocks
properties.description: » Nested graph request process_query blocks
Nested process_query blocks have the following structure (Visit the Graph Primer for more information about these values):

properties.name: metric
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: search_by
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: filter_by
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: limit
properties.description: (Required)

properties.name: nested-graph-request-conditional_format-block
properties.description: » Nested graph request conditional_format block
The nested conditional_format blocks has the following structure:

properties.name: palette
properties.description: (Optional) Color scheme to be used if the condition is met. For example: "red_on_white", "white_on_red", "yellow_on_white", "white_on_yellow", "green_on_white", "white_on_green", "gray_on_white", "white_on_gray", "custom_text", "custom_bg", "custom_image".

properties.name: comparator
properties.description: (Required) Comparison operator. Example: ">", "<".

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Optional) Value that is the threshold for the conditional format.

properties.name: custom_fg_color
properties.description: (Optional) Used when palette is set to custom_text. Set the color of the text to a custom web color, such as "#205081".

properties.name: custom_bg_color
properties.description: (Optional) Used when palette is set to custom_bg. Set the color of the background to a custom web color, such as "#205081".

properties.name: nested-template_variable-blocks
properties.description: » Nested template_variable blocks
Nested template_variable blocks have the following structure:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The variable name. Can be referenced as \$name in graph request q query strings.

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: (Optional) The tag group. Default: no tag group.

properties.name: default
properties.description: (Optional) The default tag. Default: "*" (match all).
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: access_role
properties.description: (Optional) Role description for user. Can be st (standard user), adm (admin user) or ro (read-only user). Default is st.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the user is disabled

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Required) Email address for user

properties.name: handle
properties.description: (Required) The user handle, must be a valid email.

properties.name: is_admin
properties.description: (Deprecated) (Optional) Whether the user is an administrator. Warning: the corresponding query parameter is ignored by the Datadog API, thus the argument would always trigger an execution plan.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name for user

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Deprecated) Role description for user. Warning: the corresponding query parameter is ignored by the Datadog API, thus the argument would always trigger an execution plan.
